distribution.text: Copyright 2024 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update for nodejs8 fixes the following issues:

- update to npm 6.14.13
- CVE-2021-27290: Fixed ssri Regular Expression Denial of Service. (bsc#1187976)
- CVE-2021-23362: Fixed hosted-git-info Regular Expression Denial of Service. (bsc#1187977)
- CVE-2020-7774: fixes y18n Prototype Pollution. (bsc#1184450)
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: CSAF 2.0 data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
notes.title: Terms of use

notes.text: The package hosted-git-info before 3.0.8 are vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) via regular expression shortcutMatch in the fromUrl function in index.js. The affected regular expression exhibits polynomial worst-case time complexity.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: ssri 5.2.2-8.0.0, fixed in 8.0.1, processes SRIs using a regular expression which is vulnerable to a denial of service. Malicious SRIs could take an extremely long time to process, leading to denial of service. This issue only affects consumers using the strict option.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
